intro: Trichanthecium polycomum, commonly known as the many-fruited false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces numerous small, yellowish flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, aiding in wind dispersal. Its leaves are typically basal, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture. Trichanthecium polycomum is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
